keyMoments.title: Royder Debuts at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Royder appears as one of the Marine officers present at Marineford for the war preparations and Ace's execution.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a Marine officer who will document and participate in the historic Marineford War.

keyMoments.title: Lonz Debuts at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Lonz appears as one of the Marine officers present at Marineford for the war preparations and Ace's execution.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a Marine officer who will document and participate in the historic Marineford War.

keyMoments.title: Vice Admiral Lacroix Rallies the Marines
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Lacroix delivers a rousing speech to rally the 100,000 assembled Marine troops before the battle with Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Marine leadership's role in preparing their forces for the greatest battle in recent history.

reveals.information: Holds the rank of Vice Admiral in the Marines

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace's Walk to the Scaffold
keyMoments.description: Ace is unchained and walks through Marineford toward the execution platform, reflecting on childhood memories with Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: A powerful emotional moment showing Ace's acceptance of his fate while thinking of his sworn brother.

keyMoments.title: Ace Revealed as Gol D. Roger's Son
keyMoments.description: Sengoku reveals to the entire world that Ace is the biological son of the Pirate King, Gol D. Roger, not Whitebeard. His mother, Portgas D. Rouge, carried him for 20 months before dying after childbirth.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most critical revelations in the series, fundamentally changing the stakes of Ace's execution and explaining the World Government's determination to kill him.

relationships.description: Ace is revealed to be the biological son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.

evolutionMoments.description: Sengoku publicly reveals that Ace is Roger's son.

relationships.description: Ace's biological mother who carried him for 20 months and died after giving birth to protect him from the World Government.

evolutionMoments.description: Rouge's sacrifice to protect Ace is revealed to the world.

relationships.description: Garp was entrusted by Roger to protect and raise Ace after Roger's execution.

evolutionMoments.description: It is revealed that Roger entrusted Ace to Garp before his execution.

reveals.information: Biological son of Gol D. Roger (Pirate King) and Portgas D. Rouge
His mother Rouge carried him for 20 months through sheer willpower to hide him from the World Government, dying shortly after his birth
Was entrusted to Garp by Roger before Roger's execution

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・ルージュ

keyMoments.title: Rouge's Sacrifice Revealed
keyMoments.description: Sengoku reveals how Portgas D. Rouge, lover of Gol D. Roger, carried Ace in her womb for 20 months through sheer willpower to protect him from the World Government's search for Roger's child. She died shortly after giving birth.
keyMoments.significance: One of the greatest displays of maternal sacrifice and willpower in the series, showing the lengths a mother will go to protect her child.
keyMoments.quote: She deceived the entire world by keeping the child in her womb for twenty months through sheer willpower, dying shortly after giving birth.

statusHistory.reason: Died from exhaustion after giving birth to Ace following a 20-month pregnancy

abilities.description: Rouge kept Ace in her womb for 20 months through sheer willpower to deceive the World Government and protect her child.

relationships.description: Rouge was the lover of Gol D. Roger and the mother of his child, Ace.

evolutionMoments.description: Her relationship with Roger and sacrifice for their child is revealed.

relationships.description: Rouge is Ace's biological mother who sacrificed her life to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Her identity as Ace's mother and her sacrifice are revealed to the world.

reveals.information: Lover of Gol D. Roger and mother of Portgas D. Ace
Carried Ace for 20 months through sheer willpower to protect him from the World Government
Died from exhaustion shortly after giving birth to Ace
Gave birth to Ace on Batelilla Island in the South Blue

keyMoments.title: Sengoku Reveals Ace's True Parentage
keyMoments.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku announces to the entire world via Den Den Mushi broadcast that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, explaining how Rouge protected him and how Roger entrusted him to Garp.
keyMoments.significance: Sengoku uses this revelation as propaganda to justify Ace's execution to the world, transforming it from a personal vendetta into the symbolic elimination of the Pirate King's bloodline.
keyMoments.quote: Portgas D. Ace... your father is none other than Gold Roger, the Pirate King!

keyMoments.title: Garp's Promise to Roger Revealed
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Gol D. Roger entrusted his unborn child to Garp before his execution, and Garp honored this promise by protecting and raising Ace in secret.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the depth of trust between Roger and Garp despite being enemies, and explains Garp's complex emotional position during Ace's execution.

relationships.description: Despite being enemies, Roger trusted Garp enough to entrust him with protecting his unborn child.

evolutionMoments.description: The agreement between Roger and Garp to protect Ace is revealed publicly.

relationships.description: Garp raised Ace as his own grandson after receiving him from Roger.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp's role in protecting and raising Roger's son is revealed.

reveals.information: Was entrusted by Gol D. Roger to protect and raise Ace

keyMoments.title: Luffy Reaches the Gates of Justice
keyMoments.description: Luffy and his allies arrive at Marineford aboard their stolen Marine warship, only to find the massive Gates of Justice firmly closed, blocking their path.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a major obstacle for Luffy's rescue mission as time runs out before Ace's execution.
